intro: Heliotropium curassavicum var. curassavicum, commonly known as the tropical heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite leaves with a heart-shaped base. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the afternoon, giving it its common name, "sunflower plant." Its flowers are followed by small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
